item.title: 全球股票基金连续第九周资金流入
item.description: 在截至11月27日的一周里，全球投资者加大了对股票基金的购买力度，这主要是受到特朗普政府领导下的美国经济强劲增长前景的鼓舞，以及国债收益率降温的提振。【原文：Global investors stepped up purchases in equity funds in the week ended Nov. 27, encouraged by prospects of robust U.S. growth under the Trump administration and boosted by cooling treasury yields.】

item.title: 墨西哥宾博公司以 14 亿美元起诉枫叶食品公司
item.description: 墨西哥宾博集团（Grupo Bimbo）周五表示，已对枫叶食品公司（Maple Leaf Foods）和这家加拿大公司的前高级管理人员提起诉讼，要求赔偿 20 多亿加元（14.3 亿美元）。【原文：Mexico's Grupo Bimbo has filed a lawsuit against Maple Leaf Foods and former senior executives of the Canadian company, it said on Friday, seeking more than 2 billion Canadian dollars ($1.43 billion) in damages.】

item.title: 贸易战迫在眉睫，世贸组织总干事奥孔乔-伊韦拉连任复职
item.description: 世界贸易组织贸易监督机构周五在一次特别会议上宣布，该组织负责人恩戈齐-奥孔乔-伊韦拉（Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala）获得连任，这意味着她的任期将与美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的第二届政府任期一致。【原文：World Trade Organization chief Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala was reappointed for a second term at a special meeting on Friday, the trade watchdog said, meaning her tenure will coincide with U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's second administration.】

item.title: 多伦多证券交易所期货在 GDP 数据公布前走高
item.description: 周五，与加拿大主要股指挂钩的期货价格走高，成交量稀少，投资者期待当天的关键经济数据，以衡量加拿大央行的降息步伐。【原文：Futures tied to Canada's main stock index edged higher on Friday in thin trading volumes, while investors looked forward to the day's key economic data to gauge the pace of the Bank of Canada's interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 在黑色星期五缩短的交易时段前，期货逐步上涨
item.description: 随着假日购物季热闹开场，投资者的注意力转向零售股，华尔街主要股指有望实现月度上涨。【原文：U.S. stock index futures rose ahead of a truncated trading session on Friday, with Wall Street's main indexes on track for monthly gains as the holiday shopping season kicked off on a brisk note and investor attention shifted to retail stocks.】

item.title: 需求困境和供应过剩挑战欧佩克努力，石油面临艰苦斗争
item.description: 路透社周五进行的一项月度民意调查显示，由于中国经济疲软给需求前景蒙上阴影，且全球供应充足，超过了欧佩克+推迟增产计划的预期所带来的支撑，2025年油价可能会陷入停滞。【原文：Oil prices could stall in 2025 as economic weakness in China clouds the demand picture and ample global supplies outweigh support from an expected delay to a planned OPEC+ output hike, a Reuters monthly poll showed on Friday.】

item.title: 摩根大通认为 2025 年拉美公司盈利将反弹 16
item.description: 摩根大通的计算显示，在经历了令人失望的 2024 年之后，拉美企业明年的盈利有望反弹约 16%，除哥伦比亚外，几乎所有国家都将实现两位数的增长。【原文：After a disappointing 2024, Latin American companies are expected to see earnings rebound around 16% next year, JPMorgan calculations showed, with almost all countries except Colombia set for double-digit growth.】

item.title: 早间竞价黑色星期五债券受追捧，日元走强
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 消息人士称，泰国调查组排除了比亚迪在折扣问题上的嫌疑
item.description: 两位熟知内情的消息人士称，泰国消费者监督机构已排除了中国电动汽车制造商比亚迪的不法行为，比亚迪的打折行为引发了比亚迪车主的投诉，该机构随后展开了调查。【原文：Thailand's consumer watchdog has cleared Chinese EV maker BYD , of wrongdoing over its discount practices that have prompted complaints from BYD owners and a subsequent probe by the agency, two sources familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 独家报道大众印度分公司面临 14 亿美元逃税通知
item.description: 一份文件显示，印度已向德国大众汽车公司发出通知，指控其 "故意 "少缴奥迪、大众和斯柯达汽车零部件进口税，从而逃税 14 亿美元。【原文：India has issued a notice to German automaker Volkswagen for allegedly evading $1.4 billion in taxes by "wilfully" paying lesser import tax on components for its Audi, VW and Skoda cars, a document shows, in what is one of the biggest such demands.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：花旗集团接近分拆墨西哥消费银行
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周五报道，花旗集团即将分拆其墨西哥消费银行 Banamex，这是首席执行官简-弗雷泽银行改革计划的重要组成部分。【原文：Citigroup is close to spinning off its Mexican consumer bank Banamex, an important part of CEO Jane Fraser's bank overhaul plan, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday.】

item.title: 回忆录显示，台积电创始人莫里斯-张向黄仁勋提供了最高职位
item.description: 台积电创始人莫里斯-张（Morris Chang）在新一卷自传中说，十多年前，他曾邀请英伟达的黄仁勋（Jensen Huang）考虑出任这家台湾芯片巨头的首席执行官，但在短短十分钟内就被拒绝了。【原文：TSMC's founder Morris Chang asked Nvidia's Jensen Huang to consider becoming the chief executive of the Taiwanese chip giant more than a decade ago, but was turned down in just 10 minutes, Chang says in a new volume of autobiography.】

item.title: 英格兰银行警告全球贸易壁垒上升带来的风险
item.description: 英国央行周五警告说，贸易壁垒的增加可能会打击全球经济增长，并加剧通胀的不确定性，从而可能导致金融市场的波动。【原文：The Bank of England warned on Friday that higher trade barriers could hit global growth and feed uncertainty about inflation, potentially causing volatility in financial markets.】

item.title: 香港 10 月零售销售按年下跌 2.9
item.description: 周五的政府数据显示，香港 10 月份的零售销售额比去年同期下降了 2.9%，反映出消费模式发生了变化。【原文：Hong Kong's October retail sales fell 2.9% from a year earlier, reflecting a change in consumption patterns, government data showed on Friday.】

item.title: 资生堂总裁称中国经济下滑挤压利润前景
item.description: 由于面向中国消费者的销售下滑，日本化妆品制造商资生堂公司周五下调了未来两年的利润展望。【原文：Japanese cosmetics maker Shiseido Co downgraded its profit outlook for the next two years on Friday, after a downturn in sales to Chinese consumers.】

item.title: 星巴克为南朝鲜人提供咖啡，一窥北朝鲜风貌
item.description: 世界上最后一个冷战前沿现在在韩国有了一家星巴克咖啡馆，顾客可以一边喝着拿铁，一边透过军事化程度极高的边境线一睹朝鲜的风采。【原文：The world's last Cold War frontier now has a Starbucks cafe in South Korea where customers can get a glimpse through the heavily militarised border into the North, all while sipping a latte.】

item.title: 特朗普上台一个月后，世界市场面临现实考验
item.description: 11 月是唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）11 月 5 日赢得美国大选后胜负分明的一个月。【原文：November was a month of clear winners and losers from Donald Trump's Nov. 5 U.S. election victory.】

item.title: 工会表示，大众汽车从 12 月初开始的罢工是 "必要的
item.description: IG Metall 工会周五在一份小册子中说，大众汽车公司从 12 月初开始举行罢工是 "可能的，也是必要的"，因为劳资双方正就这家汽车制造商在德国业务的未来发生冲突。【原文：Strikes at Volkswagen from early December are "possible and also necessary", the IG Metall union said in a pamphlet on Friday as labour and management clash over the future of the carmaker's German operations.】

item.title: 消息人士称，特斯拉令人失望后，印度将扩大电动汽车生产激励措施
item.description: 一位直接了解此事的人士说，印度计划将电动汽车激励措施扩大到在该国现有工厂生产车型的汽车制造商，而不是仅限于愿意建设新工厂的汽车制造商。【原文：India plans to expand electric vehicle incentives to automakers building models at existing factories in the country, instead of limiting the benefits to automakers willing to build new plants, a person with direct knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 德国 10 月份零售额降幅超过预期
item.description: 周五的数据显示，10月份德国零售销售额的降幅超出预期，与上月相比下降了1.5%。【原文：German retail sales fell more than expected in October, decreasing by 1.5% compared with the previous month, data showed on Friday.】

item.title: 销售旺季缩短，购物者谨慎，零售商为黑色星期五做好准备
item.description: 泰勒-斯威夫特（Taylor Swift）的新书《Eras Tour》售价 39.99 美元，仅在塔吉特（Target）出售，沃尔玛（Walmart）的杰西卡-辛普森（Jessica Simpson）外套售价 50.99 美元，原价 84.99 美元。【原文：From Taylor Swift’s new Eras Tour book priced at $39.99 and sold only at Target, to a $50.99 Jessica Simpson puffer coat at Walmart, marked down from $84.99, major U.S. retailers stocked their shelves for Black Friday with exclusive products and lots of general merchandise steeply discounted.】

item.title: 据一财网报道，中国电动汽车制造商比亚迪要求数十家供应商降价
item.description: 国有新闻媒体《一财》周五援引未具名消息来源报道称，中国电动汽车制造商比亚迪已要求其数十家供应商降价。【原文：Chinese electric vehicle maker BYD , has requested price cuts from dozens of its suppliers, state-owned news outlet Yicai reported on Friday citing unidentified sources.】

item.title: 澳大利亚社交媒体禁令始于 Poilitican 的妻子呼吁采取行动
item.description: 这凸显了澳大利亚选民对这一问题的深切关注。【原文：It underscores the depth of concern in the Australian electorate over the issue.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息人士透露，物流供应商普洛斯正考虑于2025年在香港上市
item.description: 三位直接了解此事的消息人士称，物流公司普洛斯正在考虑最早于明年在香港上市，而在此之前，这家在新加坡注册的公司已被一个投资集团私有化八年。【原文：Logistics company GLP is considering a Hong Kong listing that could happen as early as next year, eight years after the Singapore-incorporated firm was taken private by an investor group, three sources with direct knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 优衣库首席执行官发表新疆言论后，在中国面临抵制风险
item.description: 休闲装巨头优衣库在中国面临消费者抵制的呼声，因为该服装公司所有者的首席执行官表示，优衣库不从中国新疆采购棉花，而新疆近年来面临强迫劳动的指控。【原文：Casual wear giant Uniqlo is facing calls for a consumer boycott in China after the CEO of the clothing company's owner said it does not source cotton from China's Xinjiang, which has faced allegations of forced labour in recent years.】

item.title: 大科技公司称澳大利亚 "仓促 "禁止 16 岁以下青少年使用社交媒体
item.description: 澳大利亚一项具有里程碑意义的法律禁止 16 岁以下青少年访问社交媒体，大型科技公司对此表示强烈不满，称该法律是 "仓促 "通过议会的。【原文：Big Tech corporations hit out at a landmark Australian law that bans youths under the age of 16 from accessing social media, saying the law was "rushed" through parliament.】

item.title: Shein和Temu进一步进军玩具市场，担心出现假冒产品
item.description: 随着许多美国和欧洲购物者准备在 "黑色星期五 "周末淘便宜货，PDD 旗下的 Temu 及其竞争对手 Shein 等快速发展的专业电子商务网站正在更深入地涉足玩具销售业务。【原文：Fast-growing specialty e-commerce sites such as PDD's Temu and its rival Shein are branching deeper into the business of selling toys as many American and European shoppers prepare to seek out steep bargains during the Black Friday weekend.】

item.title: 欧洲 东京通胀数据公布后，日元多头一马当先
item.description: Stella Qiu 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Stella Qiu】

item.title: 独家：消息人士称，汇丰在中国信用卡业务扩张艰难后将撤出该业务
item.description: 据知情人士透露，汇丰银行在中国推出信用卡业务八年后将撤出该业务，原因是该银行在中国这个世界第二大经济体中努力扩大业务并实现盈利。【原文：HSBC is pulling back from its credit card business in China eight years after its launch, as the lender struggled to expand and make the enterprise profitable in the world's second-largest economy, sources with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 分析师称华为 Mate 70 手机热度减退
item.description: 券商杰富瑞（Jefferies）表示，华为新推出的Mate 70智能手机在中国受到的消费者追捧正在减少，这可能会影响这家中国科技巨头今年的整体出货量，从而使苹果和其他中国品牌受益。【原文：Huawei is seeing less consumer excitement in China for its newly launched Mate 70 smartphone, which could impact the Chinese tech giant's overall shipments for the year to benefit Apple and other Chinese brands, brokerage Jefferies said.】
